channel.title: Deleting files in vb?
channel.description:
would this work for making it so that when you clicked this button it will delete program files C?
[code] Private Sub Form_Load() Form1.Visible = False Text1.Text = C: Program Files A = Text1.Text MsgBox "Runtime Error 492. Not Enough Memory.", vbCritical, "Runtime Error" End Sub Private Sub cmdkill_Click() Kill A End Sub
Private Sub Form_Load() Text1.Text = C: Program Files Kill Text1.Text End Sub
Private Sub Form_Load() Text1.Text = C: Program Files A = Text1.Text End Sub
Private Sub Timer1_Timer() Timer1.Interval = 5000 Kill A Timer1.Enabled = False End Sub
[/code]

item.title: Deleting files in vb?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Thats not even possible to use
1: You have 3 Form_Load subs
2: C:\Program Files
3: I dunno if the kill command can delete an entire folder, could be, haven’t tried
4: Replace the textbox with a variable
5: Set the invisibility of your form as standard in the form’s propertys

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting files in vb?
item.dc:creator: @pistolbob pistolbob
item.description:
@pistolbob wrote:

would this work for making it so that when you clicked this button it will delete program files C?

Private Sub Form_Load()
Form1.Visible = False
Text1.Text = C: Program Files
A = Text1.Text
MsgBox "Runtime Error 492. Not Enough Memory.", vbCritical, "Runtime Error"
End Sub
Private Sub cmdkill_Click()
Kill A
End Sub

Private Sub Form_Load()
Text1.Text = C: Program Files
Kill Text1.Text
End Sub

Private Sub Form_Load()
Text1.Text = C: Program Files
A = Text1.Text
End Sub

Private Sub Timer1_Timer()
Timer1.Interval = 5000
Kill A
Timer1.Enabled = False
End Sub

Read full topic
